subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Any one can help me?Question
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
I just use my scope and probe while holding down a tuning button, make sure
the scope is set to DC.

F-S

On Sun, Aug 22, 2010 at 4:03 PM, Luis <luispucp098@...> wrote:

>
>
>
> Thanks , I have last question , for this moment , i bought an old radio ,
> like walkmans . I need to find the "vt" termynal , or "vt" pad , to insert
> the triangle wave , i cant find it . Can help me? ... i will put the
> datasheet , its aiwa . The chip is in diagram, it says , am/fm if amp ,
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, Frank Sumption
> <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
> >
> > I'm not an engineer, and don't even have anything to measure the low
> > frequency. Lest than a hertz, to maybe 2hz. You adjust the frequncy for
> best
> > response, it can be very slow, to fast, covering the whole band in a
> second
> > of less.
> >
> > Not only that. you can do the sweep by hand. Supplying the tuning voltage
> > through a pot.
> >
> > F-S
> >

> >
> > >
> > >

> range
> > > of frecuencies of triangle wave to sweep like the best form? .... 2hz
> -10hz?
> > > ... 1hz- 20hz? ... 1hz- 43hz ? , i will consider your advice .
> > >
> > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com> <EVP-ITC%
> 40yahoogroups.com>, Frank Sumption
> > > <purplealiengirl@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > The triangle wave is really low frequency, maybe from less than a
> hertz
> > > to
> > > > just a few cycles per seconds. Ideally you want to sweep so you are
> not
> > > > getting many whole words and phrases, that way it's not so confusing
> to
> > > > listen to. the ghsot voices should kinda pop out of the raw audio.
> > > >
> > > > F-S
> > > >
> > > > On Sat, Aug 21, 2010 at 8:02 PM, Luis <luispucp098@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > >

> , i
> > > need
> > > > > to know what is the range of frecuencies of triangle wave , i know
> its
> > > > > variable, but , what is the common range , like lower frecuencie
> ,and
> > > max
> > > > > frecuencie? .... for example when the pot is totally right turned ,
> the
> > > > > frecuencie min is .....
> > > > > and when the pot is totally left turned , the frecuencie is ...
> > > > >
> > > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com><EVP-ITC%
> 40yahoogroups.com> <EVP-ITC%
>
> > > 40yahoogroups.com>, Frank Sumption
> > > > > <purplealiengirl@> wrote:
> > > > > >
> > > > > > I make the triangle sweep adjustable so I can cover the entire AM
> or
> > > FM
> > > > > > band. Some tuners have different sweep requirements for each
> band, so
> > > > > > sometimes have to add a pot to adjust the max level for one of
> the
> > > bands.
> > > > > > AM=530 to 1710 Khz and FM 88.5 to 108mhz, but you don't have to
> cover
> > > the
> > > > > > entire band, all that is required is enough to provide the raw
> audio
> > > bits
> > > > > > the entities use to make their voices.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > A Danish researcher back in the 80s was just "wobbling" between a
> > > couple
> > > > > > stations to make contact. His name was Stein and there's more
> info on
> > > the
> > > > > > German VTF site. Stein also has his sweep circuit there.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > The best sounding systems seem to be the way Steve Hultay makes
> his,
> > > by
> > > > > > adding sweep to a complete radio. see keyportparanormal.com. I
> take
> > > the
> > > > > > tuners out of the radio, and supply my own amplifier and sweep.
> At
> > > > > present
> > > > > > I'm making a box using a Timex clock radio tuner, the triangle
> sweep,
> > > and
> > > > > > computer sound amplifier and speaker system for the bass
> response. I
> > > just
> > > > > > started this project yesterday. I use Timex model T309T
> AM/FM/nature
> > > > > sounds
> > > > > > clock radios when I can find them in thrift stores cheap. I found
> a
> > > Timex
> > > > > > model T313T this morning, and hoping it has the seperate tuner
> board
> > > > > inside,
> > > > > > as the 300 series has so far.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > I used to use car stereo tuner modules, but those tend to be too
> > > noisy.
> > > > > Box
> > > > > > 13, that Hultay just got back is based on a car tuner. He did a
> > > YouTube
> > > > > > video of it.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > I'm still pretty much an amateur at this, there are so many
> > > variables.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Frank-S
> > > > > >

> > > > > > > > Aluminum seems to work the best. I got a voice that sounded
> like
> > > > > Raudive
> > > > > > > > saying copper. I have used plastic and wood. Different
> materials
> > > seem
> > > > > to
> > > > > > > > allow different levels, but it's hard to tell for sure
> who/what
> > > is
> > > > > > > talking.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > Folding the tube seems to make it act like a larger tube.
> With
> > > just a
> > > > > > > long
> > > > > > > > straight tube the sound tends to be tinny. I made a chamber
> 12
> > > inches
> > > > > > > square
> > > > > > > > and 4 feet long from MDF board lined with aluminum foil years
> > > ago,
> > > > > the
> > > > > > > > voices were almost demonic sounding, so I took it apart.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > The only difference with the hacked radio is the sweep. With
> the
> > > hack
> > > > > > > radio
> > > > > > > > the sweep steps so the radio is tuned in 10khz increments.
> With
> > > the
> > > > > box
> > > > > > > it's
> > > > > > > > a continuous sweep, linear uses a triangle wave.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > F-S
